reviews.review_msg:
She has little knowledge of M&A or any of the other topics she teaches, she uses hypothetical scenarios to create her own problems which would never occur in real life. Her lectures are extremely difficult to follow given she speaks in such random and various tones.

Stay as far away as possible, unless you want to be docked randomly

I have taken a couple of accounting classes with her. She provides a lot of resources that requires tons of reading and prep but she is very caring and helpful both inside and outside the classroom. Getting a good grade is definitely possible if you spend the time and effort she expects.
She has really long slides with excel screenshot of examples. The lectures are not really helpful, you will need a lot of self study. Fair exams but pretty long.

She's very nice but her exams were somewhat difficult and in class just reads off slides (which are nothing like the exams). There's a huge group project and another one as well but its related to sustainability and balanced scorecard concepts when really, I'd prefer to just do accounting practice! I felt like I only learned fluff in this class.

She really cares and is really nice but wow, this is a difficult course. Her exams are on the harder end but since it's curved it balances out. Make sure to do her examples and the homework. She explains the concepts and her examples really well in class and answers questions..

She's a nice person but her exams has too many surprises. One minute you're doing consolidations, next minute she's asking you to calculate ratios on the exam, like ??  The questions are also super long so there isn't enough time. If you think you can beat the curve then go for it, I just wouldn't want to do it again.
Good grader, useless lectures

You need to come in to hand in your assignments in paper, about 4-5 of them. Her slides are super long but detailed and if you can memorize them all, you will ace her midterm and exam without reading the book at all. Class average was 50-60%. Group project average was like 91%. She is caring, flexible with deadlines and pretty on top of her emails.

A lot of the critiques of Fereshteh are, unfortunately, valid. She could improve her lectures by simplifying her examples and slowing down in her speech. BUT, Feresheth has one major thing going for her: SHE CARES. If you take her, try talking to her! She may get a little scattered during lecture, but she wants you to understand the material!
Fereshteh is a very nice and caring professor and is always available to answer my questions

You can tell that Fereshteh is nice and cares about her students, but her lectures are painfully boring. It's difficult to stay engaged with such dry lectures, very fast speech, and a constantly fluctuating voice. Low test averages with a high paper average. Responds to emails quickly. Implied that WileyPLUS was required, but that wasn't the case.

Dr Mahmoudian is a very kind woman but not a great teacher. her lectures are very confusing, and she regularly states things (both orally and in her slides) that are incorrect and contradicted by the textbook. she interrupts students while they are trying to ask questions to attempt to answer before she understands what the student is asking
Goodluck, midterm and final were extremely tough for no reason, prof does not prepare you well at all for them.

FYI think she read the reviews and made changes to her exams. Midterm was okay, but final exam was hilariously difficult. The questions she provides has nothing to do with the exams lol. 

Term paper and presentation had high averages and weren't too troublesome though. 

She replies to emails pretty quick so there's that.

Pray for the curve boys
Fereahteh was an awesome prof I cant wait to take 322 with her.

Class average is incredibly high, especially the group paper (high 80s range). There are discrepancies between her lecture slide answers and Wiley exams/assignments, and you can be penalized without question. She gets confused when you explain your questions (even in person) and a lot of the time, you don't really get your answer. Poor final prep.

I didnt like the online exams and glitches but Fereshteh was a caring prof and tried to correct the online errors. She even removed the last online assignment when there was an error in it. She also gave us a lot of notes to prepare.
The average is too damn high and the final messed up the whole grade.

Although she is accessible to students, but she seems so confused! For example, her submission requires .docx form, but you cant submit .docx on Canvas. She also uses a lot of readily available Wiley questions on her midterm. Thus you can lose a lot of marks for very minor things (e.g. writing 50% rather than 0.5).

Terrible instructor that has no teaching skills. This is a self taught course and it is pointless to show up to lecture. You gain no benefit from attending lecture. Her lectures actually make you even more confused.

Fereshteh was a very positive professor and she makes the learning process fun and worthwhile. She explains the concepts very well, and is very caring towards her students as she is always available. She also provided very helpful tips for the group project and I really enjoyed being in her class. I strongly recommend her to future students.
Fereshteh is a great prof. She is very caring, approachable, and easy to talk to.

Fereshteh is really nice but can be disorganized at times. Exams have really high averages, around 80-85% and the term paper and presentation averages were even higher, around 90%. You literally have to get perfect scores on everything for an A. Although she's approachable, when I asked her questions at office hours, I left even more confused lol

I had Bus 320 and 322 with her. I like her as a person but as a prof i think she still has areas to work on. Her finals averages are SUPER high, like 80-84, with basically you have to do well to get just an average. The term paper for both classes had super high averages too.
One of the nicest accounting profs. I took BUS 320 and BUS 322 with her. She provides a lot of notes and her powerpoints are very helpful and clear. She is always available for help if you need it.
